title: Bandbox And Lid, 1831–44
medium: Block-printed on handmade paper, pasteboard support
markings: Printed label pasted inside lid: "H. BARNES"/ BANDBOX/ MANUFACTORY,/ No. 33 Jones' Alley/ Near Second Street, Opposite Christ Church,/ PHILADELPHIA./ FANCY & RIBBON BOXES MADE IN HANDSOME STYLE/..."
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Scene depicts firemen pulling Engine No. 13 toward a burning house. Yellow ground color, block printed in pink and white distemper colors and in olive green/brown with glossy finish. This design continues three times around the circumference of the box. Border paper around lid: on green ground, branching stem block-printed in white and pink.

tombstone.epitaph:
Bandbox And Lid, 1831–44.
1831–44. Block-printed on handmade paper, pasteboard support. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1917-36-7-a,b.
